Package edu.lafayette.bci.sigproc

This package implements a signal processing framework.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Algorithm
    An abstract class for an algorithm capable of manipulating two-dimensional points.
    Butterworth
    A Butterworth filter algorithm.
    EdgeDetect
    The EdgeDetect algorithm outputs a one when a positive edge is detected and a negative one when a negative edge is detected.
    Graph
    Represents a window of data (either raw or processed).
    GyroDetect
    This algorithm detects gyro movement.
    HighPassFilter
    A simple high-pass filter algorithm.
    MovingAverage
    This algorithm is a low-pass filter using the rolling window method.
    Pipeline
    This class represents a string of algorithms for processing data points.
    Point
    A class representing a single, two-dimensional point.
    Power
    Calculates an approximate value for the average power measured over time of the incoming signal.
    PulseCount
    This algorithm counts the number of pulses (ones) that occur within the given time threshold and outputs a one if the number threshold has been exceeded.
    Threshold
    This algorithm detects when the input signal exceeds a threshold point and outputs a one when the threshold is exceeded.

Package edu.lafayette.bci.sigproc Description

This package implements a signal processing framework. The Graph class serves as a container for two-dimensional Points. Graphs may contain a Pipeline of Algorithms. Any points added to the Graph will be pushed through each Algorithm in the Pipeline in the order that the Algorithms were added to the Pipeline.

The Algorithms provided include a Butterworth filter (LPF, HPF, or BPF), a simple 2nd order HighPassFilter, a MovingAverage filter, a Power estimation algorithm, a Threshold detector, a PulseCount algorithm, an EdgeDetect algorithm, and a GyroDetect algorithm (positional and velocity).
Author:
Haley Garrison
